attributes.action: Reform the referendum process to avoid ugly divisions, uncertainty & stagnation
attributes.additional_details:
Suggested Rules:

* Any referendum needs to pass a UK Parliamentary vote by a clear majority (over 60%) to be held.

* Result rules:

- Over 60%: referendum not re-run for min. 20 years

- Between 50 & 60%: 
If in favour of status quo, referendum not run for min. 10 years. 
If in favour of change, referendum not run for min. 5 years. 
In both circumstances, referendum only re-run if evidence exists in multiple recognised polls that change has support of over 60%.

- Minimum voters’ turnout (70%)
attributes.background: The recent EU & Scottish Independence Referendums caused unpleasant divisions & unwanted economic consequences across the UK & Scotland respectively. Reform is required and new rules need to be adopted to deliver a clear majority result (over 60%) and avoid these damaging consequences.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/300437
